intro: Microtropis beddomei, commonly known as the Malayan star anise. It is a climbing shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family, native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and elliptical, opposite leaves. It produces small, fragrant fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
